newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: ANZ funds management arm nets A$41.1 mln.
newsitem.headline: ANZ funds management arm nets A$41.1 mln.

text.p: The Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Ltd (ANZ) said on Monday its funds management and insurance arm, ANZ Funds Management (ANZFM), had made a half year net profit of A$41.1 million, up 43 percent.
Last, ANZ reported an 18 percent rise in group first half net profit to A$615 million.

ANZFM managing director peter Jonson cited stronger investment markets and lower costs for the improved result. "This strong result is partly due to strong investment markets, but underlying profit was also up, reflecting a combination of lower costs and better customer service," he said.
ANZ said sales by ANZFM in the six months to March 31 increased by 15 percent to A$1.36 billion while total funds under management rose eight percent to A$9.9 billion.
By 12.25 p.m. (0225 GMT), ANZ shares were 20 cents higher at A$9.19 on turnover of 2.7 million shares.
